creditline: Gift of the Estate of Kemper Kirkpatrick
marks:
Signature, Date, Inscription

inscribed in plate monogram and date, lower center: [1543 / HSB]
text: Corinthian columns gave Renaissance architecture an immediate association of wealth and luxury, attributes of the ancient Greek city of Corinth. Despite the "blueprint" look of this print, Sebald Beham's rendition is largely whimsical.
title: Ground Plan, Base, and Capital of a Corinthian Column
